main event: Two brilliant light-sources were observed in the southern sky over Leon, New York, on September 6, 1965, maneuvering for 3-5 minutes before disappearing.
interesting points: Witnesses reported seeing single brilliant lights that flashed on and off., The objects were described as stationary and at an altitude of between 1000 and 2000 feet., Mr. Walter Brindle and approximately ten other persons observed a similar object in the area the following day., Previous reports of similar lights involved a flight of multiple objects with a 'jerking' motion., The overall investigation took on greater importance due to consecutive sightings in the same area.
witness description: Mr. Walter Brindle and other persons including members of the Chautauqua County UFO Research Group.
